text:
3 more stars added to Bronx Walk of Fame







By David Greene

CELEBRITY- Bronxites once again gathered along the Grand Concourse to immortalize three locals who have gone on to achieve great things in their respective fields.







This year's honorees celebrated at the Bronx County Courthouse on May 20 were Tarana Burke, the founder of the #MeToo Movement, “Billions” actress Maggie Siff and Hip-Hop legend Slick Rick-- who are now all represented with a special street sign on the Grand Concourse.

Siff told the crowd, "This is such an honor. I was just talking to my dad last night and he was born in this neighborhood. And he said in 1944, one of his very first memories was seeing F.D.R. drive by in an open motorcade, so I don't know but there is something about that, that goes full circle.”

Burke stated, "This is an enormous honor. I have clearly been all over the place recently and I don't think anything measures my love for the Bronx.”
